member.name: T:Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.IRewriteConditionParser
member.summary: Interface defining a parser which parses an XML node and returns the correct IRewriteCondition instance based on the node.

member.name: M:Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.IRewriteConditionParser.Parse(System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Parses the node if possible. The parser may be called on a condition that it cannot parse, if it is registered on a common verb which is shared by several condition parsers (e.g., and).
member.returns: The condition parsed. If the parser could not parse the node, it must return null.

member.name: M:Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.Parsers.UrlMatchConditionParser.Parse(System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.returns: The condition parsed, or null if nothing parsed.

member.name: T:Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.IRewriteActionParser
member.summary: Interface defining a parser which parses an XML node and returns the correct IRewriteAction instance based on the node.

member.name: M:Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.IRewriteActionParser.Parse(System.Xml.XmlNode,Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.Configuration.RewriterConfiguration)
member.summary: Parses the node if possible. The parser may be called on an action node that it cannot parse, if it is registered on a common verb which is shared by several action parsers (e.g., set).
member.returns: The action parsed. If the parser could not parse the node, it must return null.

member.name: T:Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.Actions.NotImplementedAction
member.summary: Returns a 501 Not Implemented HTTP status code.

member.name: T:Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.IRewriteAction
member.summary: Interface for executable actions. Actions must be thread-safe as there is a single instance of each action. This means that you must not make any changes to fields/properties on the action once its created.

member.name: M:Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.IRewriteAction.Execute(Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.RewriteContext)
member.remarks: It is important to set the correct properties on the context (e.g., StatusCode, Location), rather than directly implementing the action (e.g., RewritePath). This allows for the correct pipeline processing of all the specified rules.
member.returns: The Processing directive determines how the rewriter should continue processing after this action has executed.
member.param: The context to execute the action on.

member.summary: Returns a 405 Method Not Allowed HTTP status code.

member.remarks: ddd.ddd.ddd.ddd - single IP address ddd.ddd.ddd.* - class C range ddd.ddd.* - class B range ddd.* - class A range ddd.ddd.ddd.ddd - ccc.ccc.ccc.ccc - specific range
member.returns: The IPRange instance.

member.name: M:Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.Utilities.IPRange.Compare(System.Net.IPAddress,System.Net.IPAddress)
member.summary: Compares two IPAddresses. Less than zero {left} is less than {right}. Zero {left} equals {right}. Greater than zero {left} is greater than {right}.

member.name: T:Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.RewriteContext

member.summary: Resolves the location to an absolute reference.

member.summary: The status code to send in the response.

member.name: T:Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.Form
member.summary: Replacement for <asp:form> to handle rewritten form postback.

remarks.p: This form should be used for pages that use the url rewriter and have forms that are posted back. If you use the normal ASP.NET HtmlForm, then the postback will not be able to correctly resolve the postback data to the form data.
This form is a direct replacement for the <asp:form> tag.
The following code demonstrates the usage of this control.
remarks.code: <%@ Page language="c#" Codebehind="MyPage.aspx.cs" AutoEventWireup="false" Inherits="MyPage" %> <%@ Register TagPrefix="url" Namespace="Intelligencia.UrlRewriter" Assembly="Intelligencia.UrlRewriter" %> <html> ... <body> <url:form id="MyForm" runat="server"> ... </url:form> </body> </html>

member.name: M:Intelligencia.UrlRewriter.Form.RenderChildren(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Renders children of the form control.
